meanings.sent1: She will clothe the baby in a warm onesie.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, I clothe myself in clean attire.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to clothe itself in a curtain.
meanings.sent4: Kindness can clothe a person in warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The magical cloak could clothe its wearer in any outfit they desired.

meanings.definition: To cover with or as if with clothing
meanings.sent1: The snow will clothe the mountains in a white blanket.
meanings.sent2: The rich tapestries clothe the walls of the castle.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting seemed to clothe the canvas in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: The fog began to clothe the city in a mysterious veil.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of night can clothe the world in shadows.

meanings.sent1: The charity organization aims to clothe the homeless in warm jackets.
meanings.sent2: Parents work hard to clothe their children in the best attire.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother magically clothe Cinderella in a beautiful gown.
meanings.sent4: The tailor can clothe you in a custom-made suit for the event.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape can clothe them in a disguise when needed.
